upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 1. He who is called ether 3 (âkâ s a) is the revealer of all forms and names. That within which these forms and names are contained is the Brahman, the Immortal, the Self.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: I come to the hall of Pra g âpati, to the house; I am the glorious among Brahmans, glorious among princes, glorious among men 4 . I obtained that glory, I am glorious among the glorious. May I never go to the white, toothless, yet devouring, white abode 5 ; may I never go to it.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 143:3 Âkâ s a, ether or space, is a name of Brahman, because, like ether, Brahman has no body and is infinitely small.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 143:4 Here the three classes, commonly called castes, are clearly marked by the names of brâhma n a, râ g an, and vi s .

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 143:5 Yoni s abditam pra g ananendriyam.
